1.4.title: Ensure no root account access key exists
1.4.description: The root account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. AWS Access Keys provide programmatic access to a given AWS account.

1.5.title: Ensure MFA is enabled for the root account
1.5.description: The root account is the most privileged user in an AWS account. MFA adds an extra layer of protection on top of a user name and password.

2.1.1.title: Ensure all S3 buckets employ encryption-at-rest
2.1.1.description: Amazon S3 provides a variety of no, or low, cost encryption options to protect data at rest.

2.1.5.title: Ensure that S3 Buckets are configured with 'Block public access'
2.1.5.description: S3 Block Public Access provides controls to ensure that objects never have public access.

3.1.title: Ensure CloudTrail is enabled in all regions
3.1.description: AWS CloudTrail is a web service that records AWS API calls made in a given AWS account.

4.1.title: Ensure GuardDuty is enabled
4.1.description: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity.

5.1.title: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
5.1.description: Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to AWS resources.

5.2.title: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389
5.2.description: Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to AWS resources.
